repository.corpname: Washington State University Libraries, Manuscripts, Archives and Special Collections

origination.corpname: Washington State University. Affirmative Action Office

did.unittitle: Preliminary Guide to the Washington State University Affirmative Action Office Handicapped Access Maps
did.abstract: Maps and drawings related to providing greater handicapped access to WSU and its facilities in the 1970s and 1980s.

bioghist.p: Washington State University was founded as the Washington Agricultural College and School of Science in 1890, and became the State College of Washington (colloquially Washington State College) in 1905. It enrolled its first students and began instruction in January of 1892. Affirmative Action as a program dates to at least 1973, later becoming a piece of Compliance and Civil Rights.

scopecontent.p: Maps and drawings of campus and specific buildings dating to 1970s and 1980s retrofitting for greater handicapped acces.

arrangement.p: This is an unprocessed collection. Any arrangement reflects either a pre-existing order from the records' creators or previous custodians, or preliminary sorting performed by staff.
The materials remain in the order in which they were received. Individual tubes are lebeled with their contents.

accessrestrict.p: This collection is open and available for research use.

prefercite.p: Preliminary Guide to the Washington State University Affirmative Action Office Handicapped Access Maps, circa 1981 (UA1985-09)
Manuscripts, Archives, and Special Collections, Washington State University Libraries, Pullman, WA.

acqinfo.p: This material was transferred to WSU Libraries' MASC by Cindy Jessie Hillbrick of the Affirmative Action Office on February 27, 1985 and retained as UA1985-09.

processinfo.p: (MASC STAFF USE) Two cubic feet of boxes of vendor compliance certificate files were initially, but as they were not scheduled for retention they were returned on 1985-03-05

controlaccess.p: This collection is indexed under the following headings in the online catalog. Researchers desiring materials about related topics, persons, or places should search the catalog using these headings.
